Title: the batchelor party corrosion

Scene: A moment later, next to the burning van.
Sheldon: Would you pass the mustard?
Is it that the glucosinolates which give mustard its flavour were evolved by the cabbage family as a chemical defence against caterpillars?
Well, that was fun. Good for you, Leonard.

Well, I’d hardly call this kidnapping. Where’s the blindfold? Where’s the duct tape? Where’s the part where you call me and demand ransom and I try to keep you on the phone, but you hang up seconds before I can trace it and then I say I’m getting too old for this crud?
You’re seriously going to get in a van and let these two take you to an unknown destination for an entire weekend?
Oh, and how do you think you’re going to get me to do that?
Unhand me. This is ridiculous.
It’s bad enough I’m being taken against my will. I don’t see why it has to be in some hippie’s mobile sex dungeon.
It runs on syphilis?
No.
Yeah, and talked about physics with them.
Leonard, don’t be fooled. I’m from Texas, Me-hi-co is Spanish for Mexico.
Uh, mariachi bands, wild dogs, beans that jump around ’cause there’s a worm inside.
Viva la Imodium. Ay-ay-ay.
Uh-oh. According to this Mexican customs website, visitors may not bring more than five laser discs, 20 compact discs or 12 VHS tapes.
How can you be sure? VHS was king when Feynman drove this van. For all we know, there are hidden compartments lousy with Jane Fonda workout videos.
Are we all up to date on our yellow fever inoculations?
You can never be too careful. I got one last year before I went to Epcot.
It is extraordinary.
I usually don’t put too much stock in charms and talismans. However, even I must admit feeling Richard Feynman’s butt dent cupping my own bottom that does get the creative juices flowing.
What was that?
What if it’s banditos shooting at us? What if we get kidnapped? What if we end up in a factory making Bart Simpson piñatas for the rest of our lives?
Leonard?
I am getting too old for this crud.
If I see one scorpion, I am getting on someone’s shoulders and never coming down.
Right. Archimedes once said give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.

Everybody hold on. Let’s take this problem one step at a time. First, we need to decide whether we’re calling it leever or lehver. And the sooner we decide it’s leever, the sooner we can roll up our sleeves, not slehves, and get to work.
Ooh, the Green Lantern’s ring could make a big green hand that unscrews it.
Oh, please, the Hulk would never get across the border with that temper.
Yes, we could use science. But it’s your bachelor party. Lighten up.
What if that burning food attracts animals?
We do?
That’s not very nice.
What is that awful smell?
What an innovative solution. Perhaps I don’t give your MIT education enough credit.
All right, this rust, combined with the aluminium recovered from the van, is now thermite.
We blew up Feynman’s van.
Leonard: Sure. Hey, want to hear a fun fact about mustard?
Yeah.
Hey, you’re early. The movie doesn’t start for an hour.
What are you talking about?
When do we leave?
This was Feynman’s van? That’s so cool.
So, are you gonna give us a clue where we’re headed?
India.
Your house?
Fun, I’ve never been there.
If there was a hidden compartment, don’t you think you’d be stuffed in it by now?
Hey, watch your speed. I hear the Mexican police target tourists.

Sheldon, can you believe that we’re driving in a van that was owned by one of the greatest scientific minds of the 20th century? It’s like the Batmobile. If Batman was real and a physicist and his car wasn’t cool.
What?
And there’s your damsel.
Yeah, this is nothing more than a physics problem.
Let’s see, a lever, a lever.
We’re gonna be here foreever.
I don’t think the lever’s working.
There’s gotta be something else we could try.
Guys, excuse me, not that calling one of the Avengers isn’t a perfectly reasonable choice, but we’re scientists. Don’t you think we can figure this out using actual science?
They’re basically pure hydrocarbons soaked in fat. Let’s hope the lug nut expands.
It’s a bachelor party. Lighten up.
Well, let’s start small. We can always add more.
We got a flat and couldn’t get the tyre off.
Thank you.
I spent the night in Mexico with Sheldon.
Howard: Actually, we’re not going to the movies. We are here to kidnap you.
Right now.
Wow, okay.
I told you to put tape on his mouth.
Well, Sheldon, there’s something about this van that you’re going to find very interesting.
Yeah. A buddy of mine let me borrow it.
I bet he picked up a lot of cute grad students in this bad boy.
We are going to Me-hi-co.
Okay, calm down. There’s a theme to this weekend. We are going to Mexico in Feynman’s van to stay at the vacation house Feynman bought with the money from his Nobel Prize.
You don’t need a yellow fever shot to go to Mexico.
Oh, not a problem. If anything goes down, we just put Koothrappali in the driver’s seat and slap a sombrero on his head.
I don’t know. Have you watched the Olympics with me?
Hey, I have to return this van. Keep your creative juices in your pants.
I think it’s a tyre.
It’s the tyre.
Every self-respecting gentleman should know how in case he comes across a damsel in distress by the side of the road.
Wow, this one’s really stuck.
No. I took the other four off and when I got to this one, I thought, you know, I’m in a rut, let’s shake things up.
What are you doing?
Great. He’s pushing with his uterus.
Exactly. I’ll bet there’s something around here that could be a lever.
What makes you say that?
No, it’s too broad of a beam. You’d need something more precise, like Superman’s heat vision.
We have plenty of food for the animals.
Yep. A six-foot wiener in a Flash T-shirt.
It’s burning salsa. I’m hoping the acidity and salinity combined with electricity will corrode the lug nut off.
Yeah, I saw it on Mythbusters.
Great. Couple of pinches ought to do the trick.
You put up a good fight, lug nut, but you’ve met your match.
Raj: Well, you eloped and we didn’t get a chance to throw you a bachelor party, so there’s a van downstairs and we’re here to take you to a surprise location for the weekend.
Yeah, Penny packed you a bag.
Oh, not just him, you’re coming, too.
And I told you he bit me.
This van was owned and driven by your personal physics hero, Richard Feynman.
Yeah, nothing’s been changed since he drove it.
Uh, okay, let’s see. They’ve got spicy food and there’s a chance you’ll get diarrhoea.
We can drive there.
What’s wrong with Mexico?
We don’t have any of those.
Dude, how many races can you offend in a single breath?
Perhaps some of his mojo will rub off on us. Maybe between this and his beach house, we will be inspired to greatness.
When did you learn how to change a tyre?
Are you turning it the right way?
Here, let me try. You’re right, it doesn’t turn the other way.
It’s called Lamaze breathing. It helps you push.
There’s got to be a smarter way of removing it.
Of course. All we need is to find stuff to make a lever big enough to fix this.
If this was Star Trek, we could use a phaser to blast it off.
If you need a green hand, why not just use the Hulk?
I had no idea tortilla chips were such a good fuel source.
Is that enough to melt the lug nut?
Hey, look, the lug nut’s off.
Bernadette: Come on, Leonard’s doing bachelor stuff. You sure we can’t take you to a strip club?
I hope the boys don’t get too crazy in Mexico.
You guys still aren’t living together?
Speaking of Sheldon, how’s single life treating you?
You really never had that done?
We’ll take you to the mall to get it done.
Amy, I noticed your status still says in a relationship on Facebook.
Did you change yours to married yet?
Yeah, isn’t it gonna get worse the longer you wait?
Bet she’d still tell her if she got married.
It’s understandable. Amy was afraid to tell her mom she broke up with Sheldon.
Penny: Nah, if I want to see a naked dancing man, I just flush the toilet while Leonard’s in the shower.
Hey.
You really didn’t have to, whoa! That is anatomic.
Oh, yeah, right. Lock up your daughters or Sheldon might lecture them about the North American Free Trade Agreement.
Oh, it’s good. I just wish Leonard would work up the courage to tell Sheldon he’s moving in here.
We are. I mean, he sleeps here. But it’s only a matter of time before Sheldon has a bad dream and tries to climb into bed with the Leonard-shaped pile of pillows.
Yes.
Yes.
You know, it is normal to want to change your look after a breakup.
Your glasses?
Your shoes.
Oh.
Okay, well, you’re a grown woman now.
Why? I can do it right here.
No. All you need is a needle and an ice cube. I’ve done it, like, a dozen times.
Oh, come on. I’ll be gentle. Let me take your ear virginity.
Uh, no, not yet. There’s still a few people I haven’t told personally.
Oh, just my parents and my entire family.
Well, I don’t want to hurt my dad. You know, he always wanted to dance with his daughter at her wedding.
They started to, then her water broke. You know, if he finds out we eloped, it’s gonna break his heart.
Well, not necessarily. You know, Dad’s not getting any younger, so if I wait long enough, I’ll just tell him he walked me down the aisle and it was magical.
There you go. You’re all done.
I’m starting to see why you and your mom aren’t very close.
You’re not gonna let this go, are you?
Fine, you want me to call? I’ll call. Why am I so nervous?
Yeah? How did it go? Did she make you crawl into the breaking-up drawer?
You’ve been giving me a hard time and you haven’t even told your mom about Sheldon?
Fine. I’m calling home, but when I’m done, you’re calling your mother.
Hey, Daddy.
Uh, good. Is Mom around?
Okay, I’ll talk to her later. Uh, Dad, there’s something I need to tell you. Leonard and I got married.
Last week. I’m sorry, I should’ve told you. It was a spur of the moment thing. I feel terrible. Please don’t be too disappointed.
Very. Leonard is so great.
Aw, thank you, Daddy. That means so much.
It is. You’re the best dad ever.
Well, what is it?
No.
Moondance?
You killed my pig?
When?
You didn’t tell me for a year?
Thanks a lot, guys.
Before I made that call, my pig was alive and happy and rolling around in the mud. Now he’s illegally buried in our backyard next to my great-grandmother.
No. He was a beloved member of the family.
It’s not funny. You’re up. Call your mother.
Phone, now.
Try dialing.
Okay, just give me that. Amy broke up with Sheldon, she got her ears pierced and she made us eat penis cookies. Hang on. She wants to talk to you.
What? What are you doing back?
Oh, I’m sorry.
If it makes you feel any better, I pierced Amy’s ears and her mom made her sit in my closet.
My dad killed my pig with his tractor.
You win.
Amy: I know we’re not making a fuss, but in the spirit of bachelorette parties, I made cookies in the shape of male genitals.
Thank you. The veins are gummy worms.
I had extra dough.
Boy, that was a long night for me.
So, Penny, how’s married life?
Fine, I guess. I’ve been focusing on me. I was thinking about changing my wardrobe.
But then I decided I don’t want to go changing who I am just because of some man.
Actually, I was thinking of making one small change.
Piercing my ears.
My mom said pierced ears were for whores, pirates and genies.
I know, but Sheldon had this clause in the Relationship Agreement forbidding cosmetic surgery unless it’s to look like a Klingon.
Really? You have a piercing gun?
Oh, I don’t know.
You’re right. I should probably let all of my Facebook friends know. Penny, I’m no longer in a relationship.
Who?
Why?
How long do you think you can keep it from him?
That wasn’t so bad. Nice. Boy, if my mom could see me now, she’d lock me in the sin closet.
Actually, the joke was on her. I could still see the TV through the slats.
Well, it’s kind of sad that they don’t know. I mean, they love Leonard.
Uh, well, actually, to be honest, I haven’t told her yet.
I’m feeling a little dizzy from all the blood loss. I don’t know what you’re talking about.
Easy for you to say. You never had to watch 60 Minutes like this.
Oh, maybe later. Your pig dying made me sad. And a little hungry.
Okay. Okay. Fine. Hi, Mom.
You saw that, huh? Hi, Mom. How are you doing? Oh, good. How’s work? That’s nice. I’m fine. Hey, listen, I’ve been meaning to ask, how come Aunt Doe and Aunt Florence never got along?
Penny (reading text): Oh, that’s Leonard. He said they’re about to cross the border.
Penny\u2019s Dad: Ah, she took your brother out to celebrate. He just got his tenth one-month sober chip. Yeah, she’s gonna make him a little necklace.
Well, then I’m happy for you.
Well, I understand it’s hard to tell someone something if you think it’s gonna upset ’em.
Yeah. Uh, hold that thought. I’ve been sitting on a little news myself.
You know that rototiller I got for the tractor?
Oh, you should see it. It is a beautiful piece of machinery. Anyway, uh, I backed over your pet pig with it.
Yeah, he’s, uh, not dancing anymore.
I did not kill him. The vet took care of that.
Well, apple doesn’t fall far from the tree, does it? Love ya, slugger. Gotta go.
Howard (singing): We will, we will percussive shock you.
Howard and Raj (singing): We will, we will percussive shock you.
Sheldon (singing): Buddy you’re a boy, make a big noise playin’ in the street, gonna be a big man someday. You got mud on your face, you big disgrace, kickin’ your can all over the place. I have an eidetic memory. Sometimes it’s a curse.
